regulation.title: Safety and Health Regulations for Construction - Scaffolds
regulation.applies_to: all scaffolds used in workplaces covered by this part

sections.title: Scope, application and definitions applicable to this subpart

rules.text: This subpart applies to all scaffolds used in workplaces covered by this part. It does not apply to crane or derrick suspended personnel platforms.
rules.requirement: comply with scaffold safety requirements for all scaffold types
exceptions: crane or derrick suspended personnel platforms

rules.text: Definitions for scaffold-related terms including adjustable suspension scaffold, bearer, competent person, etc.
rules.requirement: understand and apply all defined terms correctly

key_definitions.open_sides_and_ends: edges more than 14 inches away horizontally from sturdy surface
key_definitions.competent_person: capable of identifying hazards and authorized to take corrective measures
key_definitions.qualified: by degree, certificate, professional standing, or extensive knowledge

rules.text: Each scaffold and scaffold component shall be capable of supporting, without failure, its own weight and at least 4 times the maximum intended load applied or transmitted to it.
rules.requirement: design scaffolds with minimum 4:1 safety factor

rules.text: Direct connections to roofs and floors, and counterweights used to balance adjustable suspension scaffolds, shall be capable of resisting at least 4 times the tipping moment imposed by the scaffold operating at the rated load of the hoist, or 1.5 (minimum) times the tipping moment imposed by the scaffold operating at the stall load of the hoist, whichever is greater.
rules.requirement: design connections and counterweights for tipping resistance

rules.text: Each suspension rope, including connecting hardware, used on non-adjustable suspension scaffolds shall be capable of supporting, without failure, at least 6 times the maximum intended load applied or transmitted to that rope.
rules.requirement: design non-adjustable suspension ropes with 6:1 safety factor

rules.text: Each suspension rope, including connecting hardware, used on adjustable suspension scaffolds shall be capable of supporting, without failure, at least 6 times the maximum intended load applied or transmitted to that rope with the scaffold operating at either the rated load of the hoist, or 2 (minimum) times the stall load of the hoist, whichever is greater.
rules.requirement: design adjustable suspension ropes with 6:1 safety factor

rules.text: The stall load of any scaffold hoist shall not exceed 3 times its rated load.
rules.requirement: limit hoist stall load to maximum 3 times rated load

rules.text: Scaffolds shall be designed by a qualified person and shall be constructed and loaded in accordance with that design.
rules.requirement: have qualified person design all scaffolds

rules.text: Each platform unit shall be installed so that the space between adjacent units and the space between the platform and the uprights is no more than 1 inch (2.5 cm) wide.
rules.requirement: minimize gaps between platform units to maximum 1 inch
exceptions: where employer demonstrates wider space is necessary

rules.text: Where the employer makes the demonstration provided for in paragraph (b)(1)(i), the platform shall be planked or decked as fully as possible and the remaining open space between the platform and the uprights shall not exceed 9½ inches (24.1 cm).
rules.requirement: limit maximum gap to 9.5 inches when wider space demonstrated necessary
rules.applies_to: platforms with demonstrated need for wider gaps

rules.text: Each scaffold platform and walkway shall be at least 18 inches (46 cm) wide.
rules.requirement: ensure minimum platform width of 18 inches

rules.text: Each ladder jack scaffold, top plate bracket scaffold, roof bracket scaffold, and pump jack scaffold shall be at least 12 inches (30 cm) wide. There is no minimum width requirement for boatswains' chairs.
rules.requirement: ensure 12-inch minimum width for specified scaffold types
exceptions: boatswains' chairs - no minimum width requirement

rules.text: Where scaffolds must be used in areas that the employer can demonstrate are so narrow that platforms and walkways cannot be at least 18 inches (46 cm) wide, such platforms and walkways shall be as wide as feasible, and employees on those platforms and walkways shall be protected from fall hazards by the use of guardrails and/or personal fall arrest systems.
rules.requirement: use maximum feasible width and provide fall protection in narrow areas

rules.text: The front edge of all platforms shall not be more than 14 inches (36 cm) from the face of the work, unless guardrail systems are erected along the front edge and/or personal fall arrest systems are used.
rules.requirement: maintain maximum 14-inch distance from work face or provide protection
exceptions: when guardrails or fall arrest systems are used

rules.text: The maximum distance from the face for outrigger scaffolds shall be 3 inches (8 cm).
rules.requirement: limit outrigger scaffold distance to maximum 3 inches from work face

rules.text: The maximum distance from the face for plastering and lathing operations shall be 18 inches (46 cm).
rules.requirement: allow maximum 18-inch distance for plastering and lathing work

rules.text: Each end of a platform, unless cleated or otherwise restrained by hooks or equivalent means, shall extend over the centerline of its support at least 6 inches (15 cm).
rules.requirement: ensure minimum 6-inch platform extension over support centerline

rules.text: Each end of a platform 10 feet or less in length shall not extend over its support more than 12 inches (30 cm) unless the platform is designed and installed so that the cantilevered portion of the platform is able to support employees and/or materials without tipping, or has guardrails which block employee access to the cantilevered end.
rules.requirement: limit cantilever extension to 12 inches for platforms 10 feet or shorter
rules.applies_to: platforms 10 feet or less in length

rules.text: Each platform greater than 10 feet in length shall not extend over its support more than 18 inches (46 cm), unless it is designed and installed so that the cantilevered portion of the platform is able to support employees without tipping, or has guardrails which block employee access to the cantilevered end.
rules.requirement: limit cantilever extension to 18 inches for platforms longer than 10 feet
rules.applies_to: platforms greater than 10 feet in length

rules.text: On scaffolds where platforms are overlapped to create a long platform, the overlap shall occur only over supports, and shall not be less than 12 inches (30 cm) unless the platforms are nailed together or otherwise restrained to prevent movement.
rules.requirement: ensure minimum 12-inch overlap between platforms over supports

rules.text: Platforms shall not deflect more than 1/60 of the span when loaded.
rules.requirement: limit platform deflection to maximum 1/60 of span under load

rules.text: Supported scaffolds with a height to base width (including outrigger supports, if used) ratio of more than four to one (4:1) shall be restrained from tipping by guying, tying, bracing, or equivalent means.
rules.requirement: restrain scaffolds with height-to-base ratio greater than 4:1 from tipping

rules.text: Guys, ties, and braces shall be installed according to the scaffold manufacturer's recommendations or at the closest horizontal member to the 4:1 height and be repeated vertically at locations of horizontal members every 20 feet (6.1 m) or less thereafter for scaffolds 3 feet (0.91 m) wide or less, and every 26 feet (7.9 m) or less thereafter for scaffolds greater than 3 feet (0.91 m) wide.
rules.requirement: install restraints at specified vertical intervals based on scaffold width

rules.text: Such guys, ties and braces shall be installed at each end of the scaffold and at horizontal intervals not to exceed 30 feet (9.1 m) (measured from one end towards the other).
rules.requirement: install restraints at scaffold ends and maximum 30-foot horizontal intervals

rules.text: When scaffold platforms are more than 2 feet (0.6 m) above or below a point of access, portable ladders, hook-on ladders, attachable ladders, stair towers, stairway-type ladders, ramps, walkways, integral prefabricated scaffold access, or direct access from another scaffold, structure, personnel hoist, or similar surface shall be used.
rules.requirement: provide safe access when platforms are more than 2 feet from access point
exceptions: crossbraces shall not be used as access means

rules.text: Hook-on and attachable ladders shall be positioned so that their bottom rung is not more than 24 inches (61 cm) above the scaffold supporting level.
rules.requirement: position hook-on and attachable ladders with bottom rung maximum 24 inches above support

rules.text: When hook-on and attachable ladders are used on a supported scaffold more than 35 feet (10.7 m) high, they shall have rest platforms at 35-foot (10.7 m) maximum vertical intervals.
rules.requirement: provide rest platforms every 35 feet maximum on tall scaffolds
rules.applies_to: hook-on and attachable ladders on scaffolds over 35 feet

rules.text: Hook-on and attachable ladders shall have a minimum rung length of 11½ inches (29 cm).
rules.requirement: ensure minimum rung length of 11.5 inches for hook-on and attachable ladders

rules.text: Hook-on and attachable ladders shall have uniformly spaced rungs with a maximum spacing between rungs of 16¾ inches.
rules.requirement: ensure maximum rung spacing of 16.75 inches with uniform spacing

rules.text: Stairway-type ladders shall be positioned such that their bottom step is not more than 24 inches (61 cm) above the scaffold supporting level.
rules.requirement: position stairway-type ladders with bottom step maximum 24 inches above support

rules.text: Stairway-type ladders shall be provided with rest platforms at 12 foot (3.7 m) maximum vertical intervals.
rules.requirement: provide rest platforms every 12 feet maximum for stairway-type ladders

rules.text: Stairway-type ladders shall have a minimum step width of 16 inches (41 cm), except that mobile scaffold stairway-type ladders shall have a minimum step width of 11½ inches (30 cm).
rules.requirement: ensure minimum step width of 16 inches (11.5 inches for mobile scaffolds)

rules.text: Stairtowers (scaffold stairway/towers) shall be positioned such that their bottom step is not more than 24 inches (61 cm) above the scaffold supporting level.
rules.requirement: position stair towers with bottom step maximum 24 inches above support

rules.text: Stairrails shall be not less than 28 inches (71 cm) nor more than 37 inches (94 cm) from the upper surface of the stairrail to the surface of the tread, in line with the face of the riser at the forward edge of the tread.
rules.requirement: maintain stairrail height between 28 and 37 inches

rules.text: A landing platform at least 18 inches (45.7 cm) wide by at least 18 inches (45.7 cm) long shall be provided at each level.
rules.requirement: provide minimum 18x18 inch landing platforms at each level

rules.text: Each scaffold stairway shall be at least 18 inches (45.7 cm) wide between stairrails.
rules.requirement: ensure minimum 18-inch width between stairrails

rules.text: Stairways shall be installed between 40 degrees and 60 degrees from the horizontal.
rules.requirement: install stairways at angle between 40 and 60 degrees

rules.text: No ramp or walkway shall be inclined more than a slope of one (1) vertical to three (3) horizontal (20 degrees above the horizontal).
rules.requirement: limit ramp slope to maximum 1:3 ratio (20 degrees)

rules.text: If the slope of a ramp or a walkway is steeper than one (1) vertical in eight (8) horizontal, the ramp or walkway shall have cleats not more than fourteen (14) inches (35 cm) apart which are securely fastened to the planks to provide footing.
rules.requirement: install cleats maximum 14 inches apart on steep ramps

rules.text: Integral prefabricated scaffold access frames shall have a rung length of at least 8 inches (20 cm).
rules.requirement: ensure minimum 8-inch rung length for integral access frames

rules.text: Integral prefabricated scaffold access frames shall not be used as work platforms when rungs are less than 11½ inches in length, unless each affected employee uses fall protection, or a positioning device, which complies with § 1926.502.
rules.requirement: require fall protection when using short rungs as work platforms
rules.applies_to: integral access frames with short rungs

triggers.condition: rung length for work platform use

rules.text: Integral prefabricated scaffold access frames shall be provided with rest platforms at 35-foot (10.7 m) maximum vertical intervals on all supported scaffolds more than 35 feet (10.7 m) high.
rules.requirement: provide rest platforms every 35 feet maximum on tall scaffolds
rules.applies_to: integral access frames on tall scaffolds

rules.text: Integral prefabricated scaffold access frames shall have a maximum spacing between rungs of 16¾ inches (43 cm).
rules.requirement: ensure maximum rung spacing of 16.75 inches

rules.text: Direct access to or from another surface shall be used only when the scaffold is not more than 14 inches (36 cm) horizontally and not more than 24 inches (61 cm) vertically from the other surface.
rules.requirement: limit direct access gaps to 14 inches horizontal and 24 inches vertical

rules.text: When erecting or dismantling tubular welded frame scaffolds, (end) frames, with horizontal members that are parallel, level and are not more than 22 inches apart vertically may be used as climbing devices for access, provided they are erected in a manner that creates a usable ladder and provides good hand hold and foot space.
rules.requirement: allow frame climbing when horizontal members are maximum 22 inches apart vertically
rules.applies_to: tubular welded frame scaffolds during erection/dismantling

rules.text: The clearance between scaffolds and power lines shall be as follows: Scaffolds shall not be erected, used, dismantled, altered, or moved such that they or any conductive material handled on them might come closer to exposed and energized power lines than specified distances.
rules.requirement: maintain safe clearance from power lines

triggers.unit: feet plus 0.4 inches per 1 kv over 50 kv
feet plus 0.4 inches per 1 kv over 50 kv

exceptions: when utility company deenergizes lines, relocates lines, or installs protective coverings

rules.text: Each employee on a scaffold more than 10 feet (3.1 m) above a lower level shall be protected from falling to that lower level.
rules.requirement: provide fall protection for employees on scaffolds over 10 feet high

rules.text: The top edge height of toprails or equivalent member on supported scaffolds manufactured or placed in service after January 1, 2000 shall be installed between 38 inches (0.97 m) and 45 inches (1.2 m) above the platform surface. The top edge height on supported scaffolds manufactured and placed in service before January 1, 2000, and on all suspended scaffolds where both a guardrail and a personal fall arrest system are required shall be between 36 inches (0.9 m) and 45 inches (1.2 m).
rules.requirement: maintain proper guardrail height based on scaffold age and type

triggers.condition: toprail height - old supported scaffolds and suspended scaffolds
toprail height - old supported scaffolds and suspended scaffolds

exceptions: when conditions warrant height may exceed 45 inches

rules.text: When intermediate members (such as balusters or additional rails) are used, they shall not be more than 19 inches (48 cm) apart.
rules.requirement: limit spacing of intermediate guardrail members to 19 inches

rules.text: Each toprail or equivalent member of a guardrail system shall be capable of withstanding, without failure, a force applied in any downward or horizontal direction at any point along its top edge of at least 100 pounds (445 n) for guardrail systems installed on single-point adjustable suspension scaffolds or two-point adjustable suspension scaffolds, and at least 200 pounds (890 n) for guardrail systems installed on all other scaffolds.
rules.requirement: ensure guardrail strength based on scaffold type

rules.text: Midrails, screens, mesh, intermediate vertical members, solid panels, and equivalent structural members of a guardrail system shall be capable of withstanding, without failure, a force applied in any downward or horizontal direction at any point along the midrail or other member of at least 75 pounds (333 n) for guardrail systems with a minimum 100 pound toprail capacity, and at least 150 pounds (666 n) for guardrail systems with a minimum 200 pound toprail capacity.
rules.requirement: ensure midrail and intermediate member strength based on guardrail system capacity

rules.text: Crossbracing is acceptable in place of a midrail when the crossing point of two braces is between 20 inches (0.5 m) and 30 inches (0.8 m) above the work platform or as a toprail when the crossing point of two braces is between 38 inches (0.97 m) and 48 inches (1.3 m) above the work platform. The end points at each upright shall be no more than 48 inches (1.3 m) apart.
rules.requirement: allow crossbracing as guardrail component with specific height and spacing requirements

rules.text: A toeboard shall be erected along the edge of platforms more than 10 feet (3.1 m) above lower levels for a distance sufficient to protect employees below, except on float (ship) scaffolds where an edging of 3/4 × 1½ inch (2 × 4 cm) wood or equivalent may be used in lieu of toeboards.
rules.requirement: install toeboards on platforms over 10 feet high
exceptions: float scaffolds may use 3/4 × 1½ inch wood edging

rules.text: Toeboards shall be capable of withstanding, without failure, a force of at least 50 pounds (222 n) applied in any downward or horizontal direction at any point along the toeboard.
rules.requirement: ensure toeboard strength of minimum 50 pounds

rules.text: Toeboards shall be at least three and one-half inches (9 cm) high from the top edge of the toeboard to the level of the walking/working surface. Toeboards shall be securely fastened in place at the outermost edge of the platform and have not more than 1/4 inch (0.7 cm) clearance above the walking/working surface. Toeboards shall be solid or with openings not over one inch (2.5 cm) in the greatest dimension.
rules.requirement: ensure proper toeboard height, clearance, and opening size

sections.title: Additional requirements applicable to specific types of scaffolds

rules.text: Bearers shall extend a minimum of 3 inches (7.6 cm) over the outside edges of runners.
rules.requirement: ensure minimum 3-inch bearer extension over runners

rules.text: Wood splice plates shall extend at least 2 feet (0.6 m) on either side of the splice, overlap the abutted ends equally, and have at least the same cross-sectional areas as the pole.
rules.requirement: ensure proper wood splice plate dimensions and overlap

rules.text: Pole scaffolds over 60 feet in height shall be designed by a registered professional engineer, and shall be constructed and loaded in accordance with that design.
rules.requirement: require professional engineer design for pole scaffolds over 60 feet

rules.text: Tube and coupler scaffolds over 125 feet in height shall be designed by a registered professional engineer, and shall be constructed and loaded in accordance with such design.
rules.requirement: require professional engineer design for tube and coupler scaffolds over 125 feet
work_types: tall tube and coupler scaffold design

rules.text: Scaffolds over 125 feet (38.0 m) in height above their base plates shall be designed by a registered professional engineer, and shall be constructed and loaded in accordance with such design.
rules.requirement: require professional engineer design for fabricated frame scaffolds over 125 feet

rules.text: Scaffolds shall not exceed three tiers in height, and shall be so constructed and arranged that one square rests directly above the other.
rules.requirement: limit bricklayers' square scaffolds to maximum 3 tiers

rules.text: Scaffolds shall not be constructed or arranged more than two tiers or 10 feet (3.0 m) in height, whichever is less.
rules.requirement: limit horse scaffolds to maximum 2 tiers or 10 feet height

rules.text: Brackets (including those provided with pointed metal projections) shall be anchored in place by nails unless it is impractical to use nails. When nails are not used, brackets shall be secured in place with first-grade manila rope of at least three-fourth inch (1.9 cm) diameter, or equivalent.
rules.requirement: secure roof brackets with nails or minimum 3/4 inch manila rope

triggers.condition: manila rope diameter when nails not used

rules.text: The inboard end of outrigger beams, measured from the fulcrum point to the extreme point of anchorage, shall be not less than one and one-half times the outboard end in length.
rules.requirement: ensure inboard end is minimum 1.5 times outboard end length

rules.text: The fulcrum point of outrigger beams shall rest on secure bearings at least 6 inches (15.2 cm) in each horizontal dimension.
rules.requirement: ensure fulcrum bearings are minimum 6 inches in each direction

rules.text: When the pump jack has to pass bracing already installed, an additional brace shall be installed approximately 4 feet (1.2 m) above the brace to be passed, and shall be left in place until the pump jack has been moved and the original brace reinstalled.
rules.requirement: install additional brace 4 feet above existing brace when pump jack passes through

triggers.condition: additional brace height above existing brace

rules.text: Platforms shall not exceed a height of 20 feet (6.1 m).
rules.requirement: limit ladder jack scaffold platforms to maximum 20 feet height

rules.text: If bearing on rungs only, the bearing area shall include a length of at least 10 inches (25.4 cm) on each rung.
rules.requirement: ensure minimum 10-inch bearing length on each rung
rules.applies_to: ladder jacks bearing on rungs only

rules.text: Crawling boards shall extend from the roof peak to the eaves when used in connection with roof construction, repair, or maintenance.
rules.requirement: ensure crawling boards extend from peak to eaves

subsections.title: Step, platform, and trestle ladder scaffolds

rules.text: Scaffold platforms shall not be placed any higher than the second highest rung or step of the ladder supporting the platform.
rules.requirement: limit platform placement to second highest rung or step
rules.applies_to: step, platform, and trestle ladder scaffolds

rules.text: Boatswains' chair tackle shall consist of correct size ball bearings or bushed blocks containing safety hooks and properly "eye-spliced" minimum five-eighth (5/8) inch (1.6 cm) diameter first-grade manila rope, or other rope which will satisfy the criteria of manila rope.
rules.requirement: use minimum 5/8 inch diameter first-grade manila rope for boatswains' chair tackle

rules.text: Boatswains' chair seat slings shall be a minimum of five-eight (5/8) inch (1.6 cm) diameter fiber, synthetic, or other rope which will satisfy the criteria of first grade manila rope.
rules.requirement: use minimum 5/8 inch diameter rope for seat slings

rules.text: When a heat-producing process such as gas or arc welding is being conducted, boatswains' chair seat slings shall be a minimum of three-eight (3/8) inch (1.0 cm) wire rope.
rules.requirement: use minimum 3/8 inch wire rope for seat slings during welding

triggers.condition: wire rope diameter for welding operations

rules.text: Platforms shall not be more than 36 inches (0.9 m) wide unless designed by a qualified person to prevent unstable conditions.
rules.requirement: limit platform width to 36 inches unless specially designed

rules.text: No more than one platform shall be placed between consecutive vertical pickups, and no more than two platforms shall be used on a catenary scaffold.
rules.requirement: limit platforms to one between pickups and maximum two total

rules.text: The platform shall be supported by a minimum of two bearers, each of which shall project a minimum of 6 inches (15.2 cm) beyond the platform on both sides.
rules.requirement: use minimum 2 bearers projecting minimum 6 inches beyond platform

rules.text: Manual force used to move the scaffold shall be applied as close to the base as practicable, but not more than 5 feet (1.5 m) above the supporting surface.
rules.requirement: apply manual moving force maximum 5 feet above supporting surface

rules.text: The surface on which the scaffold is being moved is within 3 degrees of level, and free of pits, holes, and obstructions.
rules.requirement: ensure surface is within 3 degrees of level for employee riding

rules.text: The height to base width ratio of the scaffold during movement is two to one or less, unless the scaffold is designed and constructed to meet or exceed nationally recognized stability test requirements.
rules.requirement: maintain height to base width ratio of 2:1 or less during movement

triggers.condition: height to base width ratio during movement

exceptions: scaffolds meeting nationally recognized stability test requirements

rules.text: When power systems are used, the propelling force is applied directly to the wheels, and does not produce a speed in excess of 1 foot per second (.3 mps).
rules.requirement: limit powered movement speed to maximum 1 foot per second
rules.applies_to: powered mobile scaffolds with employees riding

rules.text: Brackets shall be secured in place by at least one wire rope at least 1/2 inch (1.27 cm) in diameter.
rules.requirement: secure brackets with minimum 1/2 inch diameter wire rope

rules.text: When a wire rope is placed around the structure in order to provide a safe anchorage for personal fall arrest systems used by employees erecting or dismantling scaffolds, the wire rope shall meet the requirements of subpart M of this part, but shall be at least 5/16 inch (0.8 cm) in diameter.
rules.requirement: use minimum 5/16 inch diameter wire rope for fall arrest anchorage
rules.applies_to: repair bracket scaffolds with fall arrest systems

triggers.condition: fall arrest anchorage wire rope diameter

rules.text: Tensioning of each wire rope used for securing brackets in place or as an anchorage for personal fall arrest systems shall be by means of a turnbuckle at least 1 inch (2.54 cm) in diameter, or by equivalent means.
rules.requirement: use minimum 1-inch diameter turnbuckle for wire rope tensioning

rules.text: When an employee is using stilts on a large area scaffold where a guardrail system is used to provide fall protection, the guardrail system shall be increased in height by an amount equal to the height of the stilts being used by the employee.
rules.requirement: increase guardrail height by stilt height when stilts are used
rules.applies_to: large area scaffolds with stilt use

rules.text: Aerial lifts acquired for use on or after January 22, 1973 shall be designed and constructed in conformance with the applicable requirements of ANSI A92.2-1969. Aerial lifts acquired before January 22, 1973 which do not meet the requirements of ANSI A92.2-1969, may not be used after January 1, 1976, unless they shall have been modified so as to conform with the applicable design and construction requirements of ANSI A92.2-1969.
rules.requirement: ensure aerial lifts comply with ANSI A92.2-1969 standards

triggers.condition: use prohibition date for non-compliant lifts

exceptions: modified to conform with ANSI A92.2-1969

rules.text: The employer shall have each employee who performs work while on a scaffold trained by a person qualified in the subject matter to recognize the hazards associated with the type of scaffold being used and to understand the procedures to control or minimize those hazards.
rules.requirement: provide qualified training for all employees working on scaffolds

subsections.title: Training for scaffold erectors and dismantlers

rules.text: The employer shall have each employee who is involved in erecting, disassembling, moving, operating, repairing, maintaining, or inspecting a scaffold trained by a competent person to recognize any hazards associated with the work in question.
rules.requirement: provide competent person training for scaffold erectors and dismantlers
rules.applies_to: employees erecting, disassembling, moving, operating, repairing, maintaining, or inspecting scaffolds

light_duty.two_person: 250 pounds at 18 inches left and right of center (500 pounds total)

additional_rules_from_suspension_scaffol.text: All suspension scaffold support devices, such as outrigger beams, cornice hooks, parapet clamps, and similar devices, shall rest on surfaces capable of supporting at least 4 times the load imposed on them by the scaffold operating at the rated load of the hoist (or at least 1.5 times the load imposed on them by the scaffold at the stall capacity of the hoist, whichever is greater).
additional_rules_from_suspension_scaffol.requirement: ensure suspension scaffold supports can handle 4x rated load or 1.5x stall load

additional_rules_from_suspension_scaffol.text: When winding drum hoists are used on a suspension scaffold, they shall contain not less than four wraps of the suspension rope at the lowest point of scaffold travel.
additional_rules_from_suspension_scaffol.requirement: maintain minimum 4 wraps of rope on winding drum hoists
additional_rules_from_suspension_scaffol.applies_to: winding drum hoists on suspension scaffolds

additional_rules_from_suspension_scaffol.text: Six randomly distributed broken wires in one rope lay or three broken wires in one strand in one rope lay.
additional_rules_from_suspension_scaffol.requirement: replace rope if broken wire limits exceeded

triggers.unit: wires in one strand in one rope lay

additional_rules_from_suspension_scaffol.text: There shall be a minimum of 3 wire rope clips installed, with the clips a minimum of 6 rope diameters apart.
additional_rules_from_suspension_scaffol.requirement: install minimum 3 wire rope clips spaced 6 rope diameters apart
additional_rules_from_suspension_scaffol.applies_to: wire rope clips on suspension scaffolds

additional_rules_from_suspension_scaffol.text: The suspension wire rope shall be covered with insulating material extending at least 4 feet (1.2 m) above the hoist.
additional_rules_from_suspension_scaffol.requirement: insulate suspension wire rope minimum 4 feet above hoist during welding

more_than_50kv.minimum_distance: 10 feet plus 0.4 inches for each 1 kv over 50 kv
more_than_50kv.alternative: 2 times the length of the line insulator, but never less than 10 feet

more_than_50kv.minimum_distance: 10 feet plus 0.4 inches for each 1 kv over 50 kv
more_than_50kv.alternative: 2 times the length of the line insulator, but never less than 10 feet

1 inch maximum gap between platform units
24 inches maximum for ladder bottom positioning
3 degrees maximum surface slope for mobile scaffold movement
125 feet height threshold for professional engineering design

2:1 height to base width ratio for mobile scaffold movement
